item.title: Exploring Nutritional Data Using K-means Clustering
item.description: A Data Scientist explores nutritional data patterns using K-means Clustering on Google Colab, segmenting foods by nutrient content.

item.title: Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) Using Python
item.description: An in-depth guide to Data Sanity checks and Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) using Python.

item.title: Data Science for NET Developers
item.description: Learn why a seasoned .NET developer chose the AI/ML program offered by UT Austin and Great Learning, exploring how data science is the next frontier for developers.

item.title: Data Analysis Demonstration
item.description: Visualizing Data with the Data Analysis Demonstration

item.title: The Brain Behind the JShow Trivia Demo on WebSpark J-Show Builder GPT
item.description: Discover the development journey of J-Show Builder GPT, an AI-powered tool that generates fun trivia games in a grid format for WebSpark’s JShow Trivia Demo.

item.title: Fixing a Runaway Node.js Recursive Folder Issue
item.description: Learn how to fix a runaway Node.js program that creates near-infinite recursive directories. Includes Windows C++ program to clean up

item.title: Troubleshooting and Rebuilding My JS-Dev-Env Project
item.description: A detailed guide on how I faced issues, restarted from scratch, and successfully rebuilt a JavaScript development environment using Node.js, Nodemon, ESLint, Express, and Bootstrap.

item.title: Python: The Language of Data Science
item.description: Python, Data Science, Python history, Python libraries, Pandas, NumPy, Python for C# developers

item.title: Syntax Highlighting Using Prism.js for XML, PUG, YAML, and C#
item.description: Learn how to implement syntax highlighting for XML, PUG, YAML, and C# using Prism.js. We also explore automating the bundling process using render-scripts.js.

item.title: Automating My GitHub Profile with the Latest Blog Posts Using GitHub Actions
item.description: Learn how to automate your GitHub profile updates with the latest blog posts using GitHub Actions and Node.js to create an RSS feed.
